26B47CB28F194B04B466968AF28EEBEC.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

5D37BDF2DB9D494798A0D188B17F80DF.description: Prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer, expressing appreciation.

DF3B1B0642634E35ACC8239DA70D75A3.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

A1F94BBBBF51480AA8AA6C85E414939A.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

F2E76AD92F174FE1971CBFC23835A45E.description: Showcase one's skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

919A2B003BF44F009E660FEBC7C8A27F.description: Relate one's work placement experience to personal and career goals.

526799C056E94284AE866025C39AD21C.description: Document knowledge and awareness of employment standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

7D50FE3B8BE44FF1B249655EF0B397E4.description: Document one's experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization's 'raison d'être;' and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one's employability.

46BCCE9732624156B68D230A8963243E.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

5FDDB218AAAD4ACF955906E6BFCFCD49.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

172CCA5D65F6464689F488E5C1CAD470.description: Reflect upon one's performance during the interview.

B7ACEA3A640D45F2B41AE6692D35DABC.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

8572B73D1CE444CCA87F6AD776A0D7DF.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

A4C34AC029D34E708127C9ABCDB4C85C.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

2F1D560DE33548019F0B8729D71E23C5.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

A8F0367366394122938D334810FCC1A9.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code job description; and, conflict resolution.

891B8BB133C542069C2D835B8A7B3033.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

8A9FF8C43BD7438DAFE9C4D3E0948B20.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

E94002890F394804B353EBBF871651D5.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

DEF18342EECE4D0ABF889CC78497DE78.description: Describe and reflect on the three basic rights that all workers have under Part III - Occupational Health and Safety in The Saskatchewan Employment Act: the right to know - the hazards at work and how to control them; the right to participate - in finding and controlling workplace hazards; and, the right to refuse - work that you believe is unusually dangerous.

4B38A21E074248DDB9CD073468A903A1.description: Conduct an informal interview with individuals currently working in energy and mining industries.

4B7E0C1F9D6F4DFE8C0F8C75DEFFCC11.description: Explore the role the energy and mining industries are playing in improving working conditions, work life balance, ergonomics and inclusive spaces.

64053E74AF394E1C994285657BE320EA.description: Investigate the challenges faced by women working in the energy and mining sectors, how they are overcome and the current policies in place to protect them.

33DCE3F3CC53497EB6ECA655CED3A0E0.description: Research experience, qualifications and programs for newcomers to enter the energy and mining sectors.

087E3A20DE544C808793C59486E2F616.description: Describe the opportunities for underrepresented populations in localized areas in the energy and mining sectors.

B296EE652F7D4D91ABA4FD63084377A0.description: Discuss the recruitment and retention strategies in the energy and mining industries.

AFD6C8FB84BF44B4ABBFA0D971A36B27.description: Research the percentage of underrepresented people employed in the energy and mining industries.

453E2ECCA85748FD80282626B56CD89D.description: Explore opportunities for underrepresented populations(e.g., women, Indigenous peoples and new Canadians) in energy and mining industries.

64488A03A1C74D7B89E0A62C4A1D5D78.description: Reflect upon personal suitability or non-suitability for an energy and mining-related occupation considering criteria such as: initial and continuing educational requirements; duties and skills required for this occupation; the work environment, including typical hours and shifts worked and typical locations; current wages received in Saskatchewan and how these compare to the rest of Canada; physical, mental and emotional stresses related to this occupation; workplace hazards and safety considerations; other occupations with which they interact; apprenticeship and/or certification requirements in Canada and Saskatchewan; and, future trends (e.g., technology) impacting the energy and mining sectors.

6A0FD47B65C14C0F8DD3945339DDF108.description: Investigate the educational institutions (e.g., Saskatchewan Polytechnic, Saskatchewan Indian Institute of Technologies and Gabriel Dumont Institute) that offer programs pertaining to specific occupations in energy and mining industries.

2B49E2EAFC58484891D52B834AB460A6.description: Examine the roles, responsibilities, educational qualifications and personal and professional qualities common to people involved in jobs in the energy and mining sectors.

2B2E684BFFAD4B57BB56135CFCF06F78.description: Research which energy and mining-related occupations are facing shortages, and which are oversubscribed locally, regionally or provincially.

0FBF5185C90E489BA0036EC68A0DE36A.description: Investigate occupations in energy and mining sectors (e.g., geologist, machinist and power engineer).

72D37CCB92D545AD9780D2BEC6712583.description: Create a list of personal interests, soft and hard skills, strengths/weaknesses and traits that could lead to a career in the energy and mining sectors.

60EC248607BD4999BA6D9C7EC5930263.description: Explore occupations related to the energy and mining sectors.

8A24BA3EDE9A464BA39870C9E1455FCF.description: Explore the development and advantages of public transportation (e.g., electric buses, subway systems and maglev trains) that do not use fossil fuels.

6660BD838F0F45E893B30BC872802EBF.description: Investigate the advantages and disadvantages of gas-electric hybrid and solely electric-powered automobiles.

8D1BB5CF9149484EAF14F92C800B0033.description: Compare the energy to produce an electric vehicle to the energy savings from ownership.

5DE665FA973544789CFDB6238C8780BB.description: Research the advantages and disadvantages of converting gasoline engines to other fuel sources.

6662A91D80FA4E33B72CC776AC0C432C.description: Outline the advantages and disadvantages of potential uses of hydrogen, biogas and biodiesel as transportation fuel.

83BF10AE1A5D4D6289EC4D8318217F5E.description: Explain the basic principles underlying fuel cell technology.

A2EF05B4438449208EA3F72F35C4BAD3.description: Explore alternative energy sources used in transportation.

1468500230724E3DAA8720DF76905603.description: Explain the effect countries with a large supply of critical minerals can have when not exporting their resources.

47DB7B5376294C04B605BC9CA2062325.description: Explore the limitations of the rare earth elements (REE) market.

94AA78BD264D4929A0B379BCD7E86292.description: Investigate the security required and the measures being taken to protect valuable resources (e.g., gold and diamonds).

A357756D536C4608A7275EBE9B8A4937.description: Research possible future uses of critical minerals.

6E289658C4EC44A7BC1116DF2249934A.description: Identify the chemical components of pitchblende.

29E9A3FB29044CE38B160D5989893A4A.description: Explore how uranium is isolated through processing and refining.
